intro: Uralepis avenacea var. viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered uralepis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its natural range.
